replies.bodyText: I think we need Transactional here since we write to the database
replies.author: linusmichel

timeline.bodyText:
A resource should only check if the request is valid.
All processing logic (including db read and save) that is not necessary to checking the validity of the request should be done in a service
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: The request is not valid, if there should not be a job running for the exercise.
replies.author: linusmichel

Merge branch 'feature/athene-load-balancer' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into feature/athene-load-balancer

timeline.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: Afaik yes. We otherwise cause a LazyInitializationException
replies.author: linusmichel

timeline.bodyText: Can we remove transactional?
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: Afaik not. We otherwise cause a LazyInitializationException
replies.author: linusmichel

replies.bodyText: Then you need to load all related objects from the database so that the operations can take place without such exceptions. We really would like to avoid @transactional in such cases, because loading proxy objects from the database is quite performance intense
replies.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: We use RestTemplates for all other external connectors. Would this be possible here as well?
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: We actually use a RestTemplate here with this special set of Headers
replies.author: linusmichel

replies.bodyText:
Yes, but as far as I can see, you do not inject it and you do not use an Interceptor here.
Have a look how this is done in BambooService, BambooAuthorizationInterceptor and in RestTemplateConfiguration.
I would prefer that we use a consistent approach for the communication with external systems.
replies.author: krusche

timeline.message: Merge branch 'feature/athene-load-balancer' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into feature/athene-load-balancer

replies.bodyText: We are not consistent with how we handle this for DTOs in the code right now. I'd argue for dump DTOs that it is unneeded to add getters/setters.
replies.author: jpbernius

timeline.bodyText:
why do you mock the repositories and services here? Please work with the actual repositories and services and rather mock the communication with Athene using restTemplates and mockProviders. Have a look at BambooRequestMockProvider
Also mocks here have the disadvantage that they significantly increase the test execution time, because the Artemis server needs to be restarted before this test is executed and needs to be restarted again after this test has been executed
timeline.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText:
I consider ReflectionTestUtils.setField bad practice here.
Instead let the application-artemis.yml in the test folder set those values for test cases automatically
timeline.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: you don't need to mock a repository. just work with the actual database by saving the above exercise to the database!
timeline.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: Codacy found an issue: The instance method name 'findByParticipation_ExerciseIdAndSubmittedIsTrue' doesn't match '[a-z][a-zA-Z0-9]*'
timeline.author: artemis-bot
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -39,4 +40,20 @@
 
     @EntityGraph(type = LOAD, attributePaths = { "result", "result.assessor", "blocks" })
     Optional<TextSubmission> findByResult_Id(Long resultId);
+
+    /**
+     * Gets all TextSubmissions which are submitted and loads all blocks
+     * @param exerciseId the Id of the exercise
+     * @return List of Text Submissions
+     */
+    @EntityGraph(type = LOAD, attributePaths = { "blocks" })
+    List<TextSubmission> findByParticipation_ExerciseIdAndSubmittedIsTrue(Long exerciseId);

@@ -39,4 +40,20 @@

+

+     * Gets all TextSubmissions which are submitted and loads all blocks

+     * @return List of Text Submissions
